intro: Sebastiania tikalana, commonly known as the Tikalana sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, with a glossy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, three-winged seeds.
